intro: Phacelia artemisioides, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Phacelia artemisioides is often used in ecological restoration due to its ability to stabilize soil and support pollinator populations.
